alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Clay; Knox; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 2:56AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Comanche, northwestern Jefferson, southwestern Stephens, Cotton, southeastern Tillman, western Clay, Archer, Wichita, southeastern Knox, southeastern Wilbarger and Baylor Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 256 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chattanooga to 6 miles southwest of Electra to near Rochester. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wichita Falls, Burkburnett, Seymour, Walters, Archer City, Munday, Knox City, Iowa Park, Electra, Holliday, Geronimo, Grandfield, Temple, Petrolia, Scotland, Byers, Dean, Chattanooga, Randlett, and Windthorst. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 0 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Archer; Baylor; Clay; Knox; Wichita; Wilbarger
